comparison.description: Determines how the temperature value of the biome should be compared to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: Determines how the temperature value of the biome should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value at which the temperature value of the biome will be compared to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value at which the temperature value of the biome will be compared to.

type.description:
## Temperature

---


[Biome Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/biome_condition_types/temperature)

Checks for the temperature of the biome the entity is currently in.

Type ID: `origins:temperature`



---

### 📝 Note

You can visit [Minecraft Wiki: Biome (List of Overworld climates)](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/biome_condition_types/temperature) for a list of temperature values for the vanilla biomes.



---

### Examples

```json
"condition": {
    "type": "origins:biome",
    "condition": {
        "type": "origins:temperature",
        "comparison": ">=",
        "compare_to": 2
    }
}
```

This example will check if the biome the entity is currently in has a temperature of 2 or more. (e.g: `minecraft:badlands`, `minecraft:desert`, etc.)

x-intellij-html-description:
title: Temperature (Biome Condition Type) date: 2021-04-05

Temperature

Biome Condition Type

Checks for the temperature of the biome the entity is currently in.

Type ID: origins:temperature

!!! note

You can visit [Minecraft Wiki: Biome (List of Overworld climates)](https://minecraft.wiki/w/Biome#List_of_Overworld_climates) for a list of temperature values for the vanilla biomes.

Fields

Field Type Default Description
comparison Comparison Determines how the temperature value of the biome should be compared to the specified value.
compare_to Float The value at which the temperature value of the biome will be compared to.

Examples

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:biome",
    "condition": {
        "type": "origins:temperature",
        "comparison": ">=",
        "compare_to": 2
    }
}

This example will check if the biome the entity is currently in has a temperature of 2 or more. (e.g: minecraft:badlands, minecraft:desert, etc.)
